_metadata.description: Skincare routine, shaving protocol, and product usage rules

goal: Zero ingrowns, zero inflammatory acne, resilient barrier with repeatable shaving

products.salicylic_spot: La Roche-Posay Effaclar Salicylic Acid Acne Treatment (spot)
products.eye_serum: Eye serum (8% caffeine + retinol + HA + niacinamide + peptides)

shaving_plan.cadence: every 3 days (shave, then 2 no-shave days, repeat)

global_rules: Hyaluronic acid only applied to damp skin
No razor blades below the jawline
Retinol restricted to eye area only
Actives allowed only on buffer day (Day 3)

AM: Shave: face foil (with grain), neck electric w/ guard (with grain)
Vaseline: thin layer on neck only
Sunscreen (if not already applied in baseline)
PM: Forbidden: azelaic acid, salicylic acid, niacinamide serum, eye retinol, exfoliation

bump_cream.use: spot treat only if an active inflamed bump is present

PM: Optional: Eye serum (only if zero irritation)
Add ONE primary treatment: Azelaic Acid 10% OR Niacinamide serum
Optional: Salicylic acid spot treat face pimples only
constraints: Do not use azelaic and salicylic on the same area in the same night
If any irritation occurs, choose Niacinamide only and skip azelaic/salicylic

physical_exfoliation.restriction: never on Day 1 or Day 2; never if irritation present

success_metrics.2_weeks: less redness and fewer bumps after shaving
success_metrics.8_weeks: smooth regrowth, even tone, minimal acne flares

escalation.if_ingrowns_persist_after_8_weeks: hair exit angle problem > skincare: consider longer stubble tolerance or laser hair reduction
